result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:35 AM Defendant William Ray Eckerman appeared by video, in custody TC Jail.  Attorney Joseph Geraldson appeared by video for William Ray Eckerman.  Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin. State makes bond argument. Defense makes bond argument. Court quashed warrant. CBS. STC set.

The person failed to appear in court as required on October 20, 2022 for Status Conference. Body only.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $2500.00

9:15 AM Defendant William Ray Eckerman not in court.  Attorney Joseph Geraldson appeared by video for William Ray Eckerman.  Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has no information for non-appearance, two phone numbers not working, just sentenced to probation in Eau Claire County, state was going to dismiss this case at some point. State advised defendant is not in custody in Eau Claire County. State requests WA/FO of bonds. Court grants.
Attorney Geraldson advised defendant waives reading of information and stands mute. Court enters NG pleas on defendant's behalf. PTC/STC set. Bond cont.

11:07 AM Defendant William Ray Eckerman appeared by phone.  Attorney Joseph Geraldson in court for William Ray Eckerman.  Prosecuting attorney John Harrison Sacia in court for the State of Wisconsin. State addresses defendant not in custody. Defense stipulates to identification. State calls witness, Chief W. Prudlick, sworn in. State examines witness. Defense examines witness. State moves for bind over. Defense objects to bind over, makes argument. Court finds probable cause. BOT. Stated filed an information. Defense objects, makes argument. Court advised of prelim requirements. Defense objects, references prelim statute. Court requests case law. State makes argument. Defense makes argument. Court agrees with state.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
